comment: The first day she implied that you had to work hard to get an A.  But honestly as long as you do everything it is easy to.  She helps you in any possible way and she cares for each student.  She's hot, fun, and makes Japanese interesting to learn.  She can be scary though.

She is the best professor at KSU hands down. She has a passion for teaching and is TRULY there to help you gain knowledge and teach Japanese. She has an innovative style of teaching, and her class lectures are filled with MANY kinds of activities to appeal to auditory, visual, and kinesthetic learners. She's hilarious, caring, helpful, and AWESOME.

She is a native Japanese woman and is very knowledgable about teaching the language in easy ways for us. She is very dedicated and makes the class very interactive. I love coming to class with her teaching!
